intro: Hedypnois cretica subsp. rhagadioloides, commonly known as the Rhagadioloides bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
